sense.name: an enclosed structure holding (chlorinated) water, used for swimming
sense.examples: Bob's house has a full-sized indoor swimming pool. The hotel has a wading pool for small children and also a diving pool. They built a lap pool in their back yard.

sense.name: small body of (usually) tranquil water
sense.examples: We found small crabs and a star fish in the tidal pool. The reflections of the trees were perfect in the clear mountain pool. The Japanese garden was landscaped with small pools and fountains.

sense.name: an aggregation of supplies used as a shared resource
sense.examples: Mary joined a car pool to get to and from work. There are fewer engineers entering the labor pool than in past decades. They've hired a temp from the typing pool to help produce the annual report. Bob was picked for the game show from a pool of contestants. These venture capital firms have large pools of capital available for second round financing. These populations share a common gene pool.

sense.name: a consortium of enterprises pursuing a shared goal or interest
sense.commentary: POOL[+aggregation][+enterprise][+goal][+shared] Note: the enterprises ARE the pool, thus different from the 'supplies' of sense 3 above
sense.examples: Five high tech companies have formed a licensing pool for their products. At least a dozen firms have expressed an interest in forming such an R&D pool.

sense.name: a patch or puddle of standing liquid
sense.examples: The detective examine the pool of blood carefully. Pools of water collected in the pot holes in the street. There is a pool of oil under Bill's car. He sat in his library amid pools of books. (figurative extension) After three best sellers, he's sitting in a pool of money. (figurative extension)

sense.name: collection of money that are the stakes in a wager or bet
sense.examples: Betty won the pool at work for guessing the correct arrival date of Mary's new baby. They broke up a ring running a numbers pool. (illegal lottery) There was a big pool on the poker table for the last hand.

sense.name: the game of pocket billiards
sense.examples: They play pool on Saturdays at the student union. John brought his own pool cue. That attorney has a reputation for playing dirty pool. (figurative, unfair practices)

sense.name: a continuous region of sedimentary rock containing oil or gas
sense.examples: Geologists are calculating how much gas can be extracted from this pool. These pools contain fossils from the Devonian period.
